question:
The Montreal Protocol is an international treaty designed to protect the ozone layer by phasing out the production of ozone-depleting substances (ODS). Being a signatory to the treaty, India has successfully phased out which of the following ODSs by the end of 2017?
  1. Chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs)
  2. Halons
  3. Hydrochlorofluorocarbon (HCFC)
Select the correct option from codes given below:
explanation: The Montreal Protocol is an international treaty designed to protect the ozone layer by phasing out the production of ozone-depleting substances (ODSs). As of now, India has successfully phased out Chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) and Halons. India has completely phased-out production and consumption of CFCs with effect from 2008 and Halons from 2004. Recently, the government has introduced a fresh plan to phase out Hydrochlorofluorocarbon (HCFC) in the period 2017-23. The HCFC is currently used in various sectors including refrigeration, air-conditioning and foam manufacturing. A multilateral fund set up under the Montreal Protocol has approved USD 44.1 million for India's HCFC management plan for the period 2017-23.
